values:
Stupid England is out of Euro 2008.
I can't believe it.
stew pig.

****

I saw a classmate's armpit hair today,
not stubble mind you, but a whole lot of them.
It was highly disturbing!
She didn't strike me as someone who doesn't shave.
*shudder*

****

Went for my first dental appointment today--prob have to extract my wisdom tooth.
It's growing into my jawbone!
This is my first visit to a proper dentist--the last time I went was the Dunman High Dental School bus.
Geez..

****

Most probably putting on my braces at the end of the year.
When I was deciding between ceramic and metal braces,
my boyfriend quipped: "Metal la, then I can experiment.."
????
He continues: "Yeah.. then i can try to put magnet, electric current, zhng it and put LED light..."
He rattles on excitedly while i gawped in disbelief.

****
I want to watch Enchanted.
James Marsden's in it and Patrick Dempsey!
I thought Patrick Dempsey was Hugh Jackman at first.
(Ahh.. you all know my weakness for Hugh Jackman)
Anyways I might start watching Grey's Anatomy cos of Dempsey :)

****

Two more deadlines and I'm done!!
*boogies*

Following my headache, fever, vomiting saga,
I have erupted with a rash, across my chest *ahem*
It's so super itchy! aaargh!
How to wear bra? :(

October has always been a special month for me--
 Birthdays of some of my dearest people-- Daddy, Jess and Renee.
 The day I got to know my favourite person in the world five years ago.

This week has got to be one of the happier weeks I had ever since the start of the Assignments Avalanche.
The past few weeks were simply terrible (Miche can bear testimony to this).

Met up with two of my closest friends whom I haven't met for ages and realised
how much I missed them!

The institution is making me stupid, I don't seem to be able to write anymore.
I had such a difficult time completing a 1,000 word essay. BAH!

Anyways, I wanted to write because I suddenly feel very thankful.

Thank you--

Miche, for being in the institution with me, I don't know what I'd do without you.
Thanks for taking care of me, letting me cry on your shoulder and sorry for irritating you at times :X

Baby, for doing work, staying back in school so you can go home with me. Thank you for going early
to school so you can accompany me on the icky journey to the west. Thank you for picking me
up from the mrt station even when you were watching the last episode of hikmah (you makcik).
Thank you for eating marketplace sushi buffet, popeye's etc with me to satisfy my cravings.
You are the best! I wish I could put you in a box and bring you every where and take you out  everytime 
I need chering up.
I love you siaoban! *ruffles hair*

I don't really know what is the point of this entry--i just feel glad to be alive :)

Today, I solemnly regret enslaving myself to the supremely inefficient organization
they call the civil service. 'nuff said.

I bought all 6 of the Harry Potter books from the borders 3 for 2 offer.
I finished 4 books in 2 days.. heh..

Been spending time online looking at interesting fansites.
It's amazing how some people have so much time to analyze and
find clues to prove that Dumbledore is not dead; how J.K. Rowling
apparently dropped us so many clues to tell us that he's not dead.
Only to be debunked by Rowling herself that Dumbledore will not be
doing a Gandalf. Talk about over-interpretation. Reminded me of a
certain 20c lesson when we were discussinf 'Bliss' and the pear tree. haha.

Anyways, I stumbled upon this quote i had to show you guys:

"Author Salman Rushdie, along with his son, came to ask, after a detailed theory,
if Snape is good or bad. J.K. Rowling replied that "your opinion was correct."
Rushdie's opinion, unfortunately, was hard to follow."

Hahahahahaha! hilarious!!
We can totally understand eh, Miche??

4 more chapters to go and I'm already going mad.
The topics are soo boring, I just can't concentrate on reading. 
The book is chock full of grammatical errors, I think i paid more attention 
to those as opposed to the content.
After a few lines, my mind just wanders away and I have to force
myself back to reading the next few lines and the cycle goes on.

I was listening the Music and Lyrics soundtrack and I love it!
Hugh Grant has a surprisingly nice voice. Hugh Grant reminds me of Alex.
Hugh Grant is getting old and he's beginning to look like Mr. Prince, my JC 
lit teacher and he attacks paparazzis with a box of beans. haha.
I want to watch the show. Apollo, download for me?

I read the Heyer *sheepish*
Can someone tell me why I can finish a 328-pages novel in 3 hours and 
I'm taking 1 hour to read ONE chapter in the stupid ICT book??

Yesterday in the train back, I saw a bishounen who looked like one
of the characters in hanakimi. Very cute, but very young and he obviously
knew that he was cute, he kept checking out his own reflection. haha. boys.

So many other things are more interesting than what I'm doing now!!
Booo!

Ok, i gotta go back to reading ICT crime and punishment; Ethics in ICT Society;
ICT infrastructure & policies and Globalisation & ICT. Terribly fun and interesting, no?

Please let me get an S for this. *cross fingers and toes*

School has ended officially for me, my life as an undergrad is ending!
4 years just shot by and we're all leaving school!
*gasp*

I really don't know what to feel about graduating. I was apprehensive before
when I thought I would be thrown into contract teaching, but later when I found 
out that I would be going into NIE, I'm not anymore.

I'm still gonna be studying, and getting paid! haha!

I'm leaving NUS with very mixed feelings. In NIE, i will still have to write essays etc,
so academically, nothing's gonna change much. Worse still, NTU is so far! 
I'll take like 2 hours to reach school! Booo!

I think who/what I'll miss the most in my Uni life will be the Olympians.



I'm so gonna miss seeing everyone's sleepy faces in the morning everyday in class,
having lunch in oily fong seng,yih, and the wedding banquet. Talking about anything 
and everything, all the TMIs, CMIs and PMSs, laughing hysterically together, sighing in unison, 
and basically doing EVERYTHING together.

When we all start working, we wouldn't be able to meet so often anymore, I'm so gonna miss 
all of you!! *sniff*

Sigh, enough sentimentalising! I know we're gonna be fast friends till we grow old, living in
Dionysus' villa! :)

On our last day of school, we went to the ktv at last! Dionysus has been bugging us the entire 
semester.



When you all become famous people, remember that I have the very INCRIMINATING
bsb video with me. Hahaha!

On Friday, we trooped down the hallways of AS5 to take pictures with the teachers.



Us with DA, one of the best lecturers in the Lit department and also our favourite!



With the HOT PROF! I dunno why I look so weird here, I must have been laughing
at a joke patty said, as usual, while keeping a straight face (for the camera).



With Tweedy, our HOD, in his office, which had a view to die for!



With taitai, the flash makes her look really scary here, haha.



With GY! He looks so cute here right?



With Holden, my supervisor. Poor man was drenched by the rain but still
obliged us with a pic :)



Us with bau masam who didn't bau so masam that day. haha..



With Chitra, Miche's supervisor.



Us with Wally.

Last but not least, Our LIT DEPT!



BOOOOHOOOO!!!
I miss all of you!

1) Something hilarious happened at the Career Fair today.
I was accompanying my friends who were there to submit their cv and talk to
various companies. Since my career is already mapped out for me, I was standing 
against a pillar, waiting for them while reading my Sign of Four.

Out of the corner of my eye, I saw this man approaching me. He came to ask me
whether I was a final year student, I told him yes but I'm not interested cos I am
already bonded to be a teacher. He did not give up, he pressed on, asking me
what i was majoring in, and so I told him Literature.

And he told me, with a humsup smile on his face, 
"oh! I major in finance and romance.."

*faints*

I laughed outright in his face but he was so thick-skinned he continued to
tell me that he is a branch manager of Great Eastern Life and asked if I wanted to
leave down my particulars with him for further talks and positions in his office which
he can guarantee for me blah blah blah..

OMG! He is middle-aged, around mid-forties I think, slightly pudgy and balding.
hahahaha..

To give him credit, I must had it to him to be a ble to contextualize his pick-up
line so aptly with the flow of the "conversation". Highly original.



2) Now that I don't care so much about grades and get uber stressed out by school,
I feel so so much happier. I'm so slack I find it funny..
Though I don't necessarily finish reading my novels on time,
I do things at my own pace, learning Jap, eating horrible food in school, 
hanging out with the Olympians, laughing and entertaining ourselves in the Coop.
I'm really enjoying my last semester in school.

My tuition kid has moved from Tanah Merah to Pasir Panjang, he is now 10 mins from 
school but 45 mins from home and I pay $20 extra of bus fare now. But somehow, I
find it less of a chore to go for tuition now cos it's so convenient. Maybe it's cos I'm 
getting used to my tuition kid's antics now, I swear he treats me like his elder sister
or smth. He burps in my face and threatens to wipe his booger on me, just like
my brother. haha.


3) Baby got me a pretty pink bed! yeay! XD

I'M A HAPPY GIRL :):)

The first thing I'm gonna do after I get my medical benefits from MOE
is to go for an operation to remove my sinus or whatever it is in my nose
that constantly gives me problems. I don't care if they grow back again, 
i'll just remove it again. GAH!

My sinus condition has given me a swollen eye and now induced one of the
worst bouts of throat inflammation.

I woke up with my entire nose congested and breathing through my mouth
hurts my throat. My eyelids were also swollen and i had a pretty high fever. 
Went to the doctor and spent $58 on medicines, the antibiotics are humongous, 
i think they're the same one i took for my sinus induced eye infection the other time.

Was supposed to go out for tea and movie with the Olympians today and
in the end spent the afternoon sleeping and feeling feverish. I hope I'm well enough
to go watch the Singapore-Malaysia match tmr.

Fir said his friends told him to bring an extra set of clothes, in case the malaysian fans
throw water bombs at us.. haha..

Fir bought me a large Mandarin Orange tea from Macs and soon kueh from Qi Ji
to cheer me up.. :)

I think I finally am ready to move on.

I think that despite all that has happened to me, I still am an idealistic person at heart.
I get bouts of depression and pessimism all the time but there are still things that I 
hold dear, things that makes life worthwhile.

I've come so far short in so many things that I set out to do, I haven't done some stuffs 
that I meant to do, I haven't lived up to my ideals.

But i guess none of us ever do.

I don't know where I came across this: "Not failure but low aim is crime"
I think we must have ideals and try to live up to them even if we eventually never
quite succeed.

I failed but i guess i should just put it behind me and not carry it forward.
That's life. I'm still proud of what I did and I know it's a memory that I will cherish and
look back with fond memories.

I know I have so much to feel thankful for all the love care and concern.

I'm so thankful for friendship, it has really beautified my life.

The name of friendship is so often degraded to a kind of intimacy that has nothing of
real friendship in it. 
Friends should only look for the best in each other and we should give each other 
the best that is in us, don't you think? Only then would the friendship be beautiful.

Thank you my friends for letting me escape while i needed it.

Darling butt, thank you for your understanding my need to keep to myself, at least until you
hunted me down at home. heh.

Renee, Miche, Luke, thank you for your friendship, the happy times and offers of ambush. :)
I'm really happy for the two of you and miche, jia you!
My lovely daemon, thank you darling.. *muah* you know i love you!
You guys are the best thing to happen to me in NUS! And I'm really thankful :)

And of course my love, my friend, my confidante.
Thank you for letting me indulge in melancholy i only show to you.

I'm a lucky girl.
And I'm moving on to greater things, i hope :)

conversation with my 8 year old cousin:

W: Cece, why december always so cold?
M: Hmm.. cos it's the monsoon season.
W: What's that?
M: (explains about the wind blah blah..)
W: ohh.. i thought cos the cold country got snow, then the snow blow over then melt become rain.

ahhahaha.. so cute.

conversation with **** ( don't ask me who):

****: my boyfriend is so stable and steady. Very good for me.
me: that's good what.
****: Ah! he's like vegetables!
me: !!! ><
****: ya! vegetables very good what, got a lot of vitamins and good for health. and i like to eat vegetables.
me: hahahhahaha...

Would you describe your bf like this? first time i've heard and it cracks me up.

ok, i'm very bored. Can someone bring me out to do stuffs which are fun but no need money one..

Back from a week long retreat in the comfort of my own home, free to do anything I want 
without worrying about irritating relatives :)

That aside, going back to Indonesia made me think a lot.

Looking at how backward it is and how the people live made me think of all the readings
that I read for my thesis. Thinking about how a country, my country with such abundant 
natural and human resources fail to progress is just depressing. It also made me admire
people like Pramoedya even more.

I saw Indonesians who are lazy and corrupt, whose very appearance speaks of their laziness.
On the ferry ride back, the crew of the ferry had uncombed hair and wore crumpled shirts, and
once the ferry left the harbour, proceeded to the back of the ferry to smoke or sleep. I saw groups
of jobless people, whiling their time away, smoking and gambling. At the custom office, the officials
operate according to the system of "uang kopi", which is coffee money a.k.a bribes. It irritated me 
to no end looking at them.

On the other hand, there are very industrious people too. There's this makeshift stall near my home,
they only open at night and the food is delicious. On the first night I was there, they were closed. 
The family lives near us, so my mum found out that two of the brothers got into a serious accident 
and had to be hospitalised. I was very upset cos I thought that I would not be able to eat it as i'll 
only be back for a week. But on the 4th night, they set up their stall and so we went. The two workers 
still had stitches on their faces and arms, and were limping. Yet, the business continues, they are 
still working to earn a living.
It was very heartening, and we went to eat there 3 nights in a row.

People do work hard, but they can't earn much also, because there're so many taxes to be paid 
and for the lower income groups, even 200 rupiahs (less than 10 cents) increase in price affects 
them significantly. A taxi driver was telling us about the price of oil. A lot of the food vendors in Indonesia 
rely on oil, not cooking oil, but the oil used to power their stoves. In the past, a 500ml bottle of oil costs 
2000 Rp, but now the pricesare increased to 7000Rp. A lot of them have gone out of business cos they 
can't afford it, many are turning to using wood to fuel their stoves. How primitive is that? 61 years of 
independence, and people are still living in the slums. It makes me really really sad. 
I don't know how Indonesia can progress like this, and yet I still feel really attached to the country.

Ah well, enough of my musings.

On a lighter note:



I got a haircut but the fringe is too short for my liking, can't wait for it to grow out! ><

A new addition to my Kuma Kuma family:





Ain't he sweet :)

Went out today and saw one of the most beautiful Christmas tree this season:



Of course it helps that it's made of diamonds.. Hehe.. 

For kaypoh Zooey, this is the SURPRISE that fir made. XD



I missed you so much while i'm away, so glad I'm back! <3

I spent the last 3 days watching FULL HOUSE and I was ogling at Rain
the whole while.

Today I watched the last 2 episodes on Fir's laptop in school.
So i kept showing him footages of Rain being adorable and hot.
Afterwhich i surfed Youtube for his mtvs and even wikipedia and
various sites for his biography and pictures. Hehe..

So my boyfriend took all these in his stride and did not once say
anything that showed that he was jealous as I would expect him to be.

Hmm.. improvement.. I thought.

Until once i was going to start doing my work after my delish fix of Rain,

My boyfriend said: "Now pass me the laptop, I want to surf for J LO."

HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!

Wooooohooooo!

I'm veerrraaahh happieeee now!

hehehehehehehehe

DW star had an excursion to expo for the penguin books warehouse sale!

I almost went crazy!

The books were priced at $3 to $8! How can I not go mad? when usually my books are like at least $20??

My daemon had to stop me from buying so many books, I think it's worse than clothes shopping.. hahaha..

Well, I'm a happy girl cos I have so many books to look forward to reading!

Zooey, the shelf not enough already for my books, cos I let my bro use one section of it..

I think I will have to evict him soon.. hehe.. :)

I was gonna spend my lazy saturday morning in bed under my
comforter till 12 pm today.

But at 8 a.m. I was woken up my brother's frantic search for 
his wallet. He was so sure he brought it home after his swim
at his friend's place last night. So i dragged myself out
of bed and helped him look around but to no avail.

Then something struck me. 

Yesterday Fir came over at night to watch V for Vendetta,
which by the way was one of the BEST show I've ever watched.
But that's besides the point, the point is when he came,
I had to remove the heavy planks from my bed downstairs. He 
came just in time so we brought it down together. Before we
went down, cos he was carrying a laptop bag and he put his 
handphone inside the bag to put inside my room.

The thing is, I distinctly remembered also that when he went
home, he was holding a wallet and a handphone in his hands.
I started laughing and laughing. My bro just looked upon me 
in pique, like excuse me, here I am panicking and my sis just 
suddenly start laughing like a mad woman. 

My dear boyfriend, who placed his handphone on my dressing 
table, must have brought my bro's wallet home with him, 
thinking it was his. And knowing him, he wouldn't have looked
inside it at all after he reached home.

So I called him and true enough, he took it by mistake cos
the wallet was also black like his.

My observational and sleuthing skills good right? 

Or maybe, I just know too well what a blur blob my 
dearest boyfriend is.

Hahahahahahahaha..

My bro and I had a really good laugh this morning, what a way
to start a day!

**************************************************************

On hindsight, i realised my tirade in the previous entry seems
like I was making a mountain out of a molehill. How childish is
it to blog about how angry you are abt beds?!

And those who know me should know that I am not given to
vulgarities. In fact I don't think my close friends, jess and tess 
who've known me for 10 years now, have heard me say the F word more
than 5 times before.

I kinda set record with this entry. haha.

I told zooey maybe I should go edit and censor my entry.
But she told me I shouldn't have to censor myself.

Well whatever, I was really really upset. So there.

If there's only one thing to be gotten out of
this thesis experience, it'll be that I am truly
blessed with wonderful friends :)

Woke up with a swollen, itchy burning red eye. 

I'm supposed to do intensive revising of my chapters today,
but i still can't summon up enough motivation to do it.

This sem has been a long tiring journey. I was looking back in my 
uni life, my entries about school are all about how busy I had been
during the semesters juggling tuition, deadlines, maintaining grades. 
I feel put out just reading them.

Is it worth it, I ask myself? Is this what I want?

Even if i get all Ds for my subjects,I will have no problems getting
a 2nd lower, why am I working so damn hard? Should I just stop working
so damn hard for everything, and just let myself cruise through?

I am not an extremely competitive person, but since young, when family 
members constantly compare you to other cousins, I have cultivated an
innate drive to over-achieve. Though my family is not as well-off, I'm
treated less civilly by others, I was determined to show them I could 
rise up above external limitations and do much better than the rest. 
The way I could do this was through my results. Despite these, I have
never gotten praise, instead people become more critical. When I got
into RJ, no one congratulated me, instead they criticised, "she's gonna
become arrogant". They have never stopped to think, what effect these
constant criticisms have on a developing psychology of a young girl, one
who was constantly insecure and in need of validation. I like to think
that they are just being sour grapes, but that doesn't make me feel any 
better. I developed an inferiority complex, scared to venture, worried 
about what people think of me, scared to under-achieve.

I don't understand how people can be so mean spirited. Is there joy to be
derived from being mean to others?

SIGH. I don't really know what is the point of writing all these. Maybe I'm
not making a point at all, like my thesis. Just needed to get it out, start
writing. I'm having a really bad bout of PMS, hurry up come already!

"The biggest problem I'm finding at the moment is that you don't give a clear 
definition--or show a convincing understanding of--dialectics!"

This was my supervisor's preliminary comment on my chapter 3. And My chapter
was all about dialectics. And you know what, i agree with him. I suck. 
Can I do this? Now I'm really scared.

I am pregnant. Pardon the metaphor, but writing my thesis is like giving birth. I think about it every moment of the day, ideas just pop out randomly and i will be scrambling to jot it down on post-its. I was bathing when an inspiration struck and I was desperately chanting the keywords to myself in order to remember it after I finish bathing. I am obsessed. I constanly worry about a possible congenital defect in my progeny. I suffer from pre-natal blues, and highly possible post-natal blues too! (after submitting my thesis, i will continue fretting about it) Therefore, I have decided to keep track of my "pregnancy" right till the day I "give birth"

Voila! conception! [1st September]

Internalising the texts and secondary readings, I finally came up with a clear idea of what I want to focus on and eventually write a 12,000 words thesis about. 
Typed out a structure and got the green lights to go ahead from my supervisor.
12 000 words seemed a lot initially, but when I broke it down into chapters, it looks pretty doable, 5 parts in all,average of 2,500 words.It's like doing 5 essays in one sem, manageable.. (I hope).

Thesis title: (Un)masking Fiction: Postcoloniality in Pramoedya Ananta Toer's The Buru Quartet

Gestation: Start of 1st Trimester [6th September]

Typing out my introductory chapter now, 2000 words. It;s due on Friday. Mind is in a blank now, but i have been assured by my fellow suffering pregnant sister and brother that it is normal, they are experiencing the same thing. Hopefuly, it will start fleshing out soon, now that i already have the skeleton (structure).. see how appropriate is the pregnancy metaphor??

P.s. I haven't been able to meet up or keep in touch with you but you're always in my thoughts, thanks for being so understanding and I miss you! We'll meet up during the hols ok?
        *BIG HUGGG*

Alrighty! I've been tagged by adino to do this thingie but before i proceed, some updates:

I have been mulling over this since the fateful afternoon on 25th May 06. Exactly 3 weeks after the end of my last paper, 
my results were released at 1500. After the whole wretched semester of labour, i.e. piles and piles of neverending readings,
book after book, tests after tests, essays after essays and finally exam after exam, revelation time... (thank you for indulging me in my melodrama)

I was on standby since 1430, located the webpage, typed in my matriculation number and pin number, my mouse cursor over 
the log-in tab, all prepared to click on it once my laptop clock registers 1500. Of course i put a paper over my laptop screen, I didn't
want to receive a rude shock (just in case). In case you haven't realised, I am extremely paranoid. Two days earlier, over dinner with
my lecturer, she told me and my friend that we needn't worry about one of the module, we were on the top 3 list. BUT, there were still 
4 other modules to worry about, 2 of which were killers.

Right, at 1455, I had a stomachache due to the tension and in the end i only got to check my results at 1512. -_-"
All my preparations were undue. [Fir came over to give me moral support..haha.. thanks baby.] 

Upon seeing my results, I couldn't describe what i felt at that moment. My CAP was 4.0. I screamed. It was a scream of joy, but at the same time, a scream of frustration. After slogging for 2 semesters, I managed to pull up my CAP to qualify for a place to do my Honours Thesis. With my CAP, I would graduate with a Second-upper Honours, provided i do not fall from grace. The NUS CAP system works in an extremely odious, diabolical way, such that it is effortless to drop 0.1 but ridiculously arduos to go up 0.01. I needed 2 semesters of hardwork 
to pull my CAP up by 0.02. My CAP now, is right on the dot for 2nd-upper. I CANNOT drop, not even by 0.01. No one, in the whole faculty can do anything if i graduate with a 3.99 by the end of my 4th year. I would be awarded a 2nd-lower, 0.01 away from a 2nd-upper. NUS is CRUEL.

With a CAP of 4, I can do a thesis. WHat was milling through my mind at this moment was, what if i churn out a 12,000 word thesis and my CAP drops, I will be still graduate with a 2nd-lower, is there a point? I hated my life. 

I worked so hard to improve my CAP, but I was disappointed at how it turned out to be kinda like a joke. To do or not to do? I only had 4 days to decide. I had to submit a thesis proposal by the 29th May. I had to decide, do i really want it bad enough? Should i take the risk, will my effort be wasted at the end of the day? Is it worth it, to have to continue to work so hard for 2 more semesters, knowing that there is a possibility that I might not get what I wanted? I was in such a dilemma. 

I talked to many people, thanks butt, my daemon, renee, luke and char for your advise, but at the end of the day, the decision still lies with me. For the next two days, I thought hard about it, thanks baby for allowing our conversation to be perpetually about my dilemma and listening patiently to my grouses even though your results were coming out 2 days later and you were equally worried about your results. I looked back on my life in NUS. I remembered telling myself of how i want to make the most out of my university life cos it was not easy getting there. I remembered telling myself, that i am in University to study, who cares if I don't have a happening life, who cares if i have to give tuition 6 days a week just to get by. All I want is to get good grades and do my mum proud. My first year of University was fraught with devastations, one after another, but i pulled through it, even more determined to to excel. Since then on, pulling up my grades were my main motivation and i worked towards my goal, as difficult as it was to proceed. I realized then, what i have been working for so far and now that i finally attained it, how can i back down to my fears and not go ahead? I foresee tough semesters ahead to keep afloat, but since when have my semesters been easy? As long as I am willling to work doubly hard, I will pull through right? 

Yeap, so I have decided to do a thesis and I will keep my CAP above 4. I know i can do it and i will have the support of loving friends and family when i get too stressed up. Most of all I want YOU to be proud, knowing I have not let you down, after all that you've done for me. I have never let you out of my mind and I know you're still watching over me.

TADA!

The books I will be basing my thesis upon. :) Wish me luck!

Being an Evil Overlord seems to be a good career choice. It pays well, there are all sorts of perks and you can set your own hours. However every Evil Overlord I've read about in books or seen in movies invariably gets overthrown and destroyed in the end. I've noticed that no matter whether they are barbarian lords, deranged wizards, mad scientists or alien invaders, they always seem to make the same basic mistakes every single time. With that in mind, allow me to present...

The Top 100 Things I'd Do
If I Ever Became An Evil Overlord

  1. My Legions of Terror will have helmets with clear plexiglass visors, not face-concealing ones.
  2. My ventilation ducts will be too small to crawl through.
  3. My noble half-brother whose throne I usurped will be killed, not kept anonymously imprisoned in a forgotten cell of my dungeon.
  4. Shooting is not too good for my enemies.
  5. The artifact which is the source of my power will not be kept on the Mountain of Despair beyond the River of Fire guarded by the Dragons of Eternity. It will be in my safe-deposit box. The same applies to the object which is my one weakness.
  6. I will not gloat over my enemies' predicament before killing them.
  7. When I've captured my adversary and he says, "Look, before you kill me, will you at least tell me what this is all about?" I'll say, "No." and shoot him. No, on second thought I'll shoot him then say "No."
  8. After I kidnap the beautiful princess, we will be married immediately in a quiet civil ceremony, not a lavish spectacle in three weeks' time during which the final phase of my plan will be carried out.
  9. I will not include a self-destruct mechanism unless absolutely necessary. If it is necessary, it will not be a large red button labelled "Danger: Do Not Push". The big red button marked "Do Not Push" will instead trigger a spray of bullets on anyone stupid enough to disregard it. Similarly, the ON/OFF switch will not clearly be labelled as such.
  10. I will not interrogate my enemies in the inner sanctum -- a small hotel well outside my borders will work just as well.
  11. I will be secure in my superiority. Therefore, I will feel no need to prove it by leaving clues in the form of riddles or leaving my weaker enemies alive to show they pose no threat.
  12. One of my advisors will be an average five-year-old child. Any flaws in my plan that he is able to spot will be corrected before implementation.
  13. All slain enemies will be cremated, or at least have several rounds of ammunition emptied into them, not left for dead at the bottom of the cliff. The announcement of their deaths, as well as any accompanying celebration, will be deferred until after the aforementioned disposal.
  14. The hero is not entitled to a last kiss, a last cigarette, or any other form of last request.
  15. I will never employ any device with a digital countdown. If I find that such a device is absolutely unavoidable, I will set it to activate when the counter reaches 117 and the hero is just putting his plan into operation.
  16. I will never utter the sentence "But before I kill you, there's just one thing I want to know."
  17. When I employ people as advisors, I will occasionally listen to their advice.
  18. I will not have a son. Although his laughably under-planned attempt to usurp power would easily fail, it would provide a fatal distraction at a crucial point in time.
  19. I will not have a daughter. She would be as beautiful as she was evil, but one look at the hero's rugged countenance and she'd betray her own father.
  20. Despite its proven stress-relieving effect, I will not indulge in maniacal laughter. When so occupied, it's too easy to miss unexpected developments that a more attentive individual could adjust to accordingly.
  21. I will hire a talented fashion designer to create original uniforms for my Legions of Terror, as opposed to some cheap knock-offs that make them look like Nazi stormtroopers, Roman footsoldiers, or savage Mongol hordes. All were eventually defeated and I want my troops to have a more positive mind-set.
  22. No matter how tempted I am with the prospect of unlimited power, I will not consume any energy field bigger than my head.
  23. I will keep a special cache of low-tech weapons and train my troops in their use. That way -- even if the heroes manage to neutralize my power generator and/or render the standard-issue energy weapons useless -- my troops will not be overrun by a handful of savages armed with spears and rocks.
  24. I will maintain a realistic assessment of my strengths and weaknesses. Even though this takes some of the fun out of the job, at least I will never utter the line "No, this cannot be! I AM INVINCIBLE!!!" (After that, death is usually instantaneous.)
  25. No matter how well it would perform, I will never construct any sort of machinery which is completely indestructible except for one small and virtually inaccessible vulnerable spot.
  26. No matter how attractive certain members of the rebellion are, there is probably someone just as attractive who is not desperate to kill me. Therefore, I will think twice before ordering a prisoner sent to my bedchamber.
  27. I will never build only one of anything important. All important systems will have redundant control panels and power supplies. For the same reason I will always carry at least two fully loaded weapons at all times.
  28. My pet monster will be kept in a secure cage from which it cannot escape and into which I could not accidentally stumble.
  29. I will dress in bright and cheery colors, and so throw my enemies into confusion.
  30. All bumbling conjurers, clumsy squires, no-talent bards, and cowardly thieves in the land will be preemptively put to death. My foes will surely give up and abandon their quest if they have no source of comic relief.
  31. All naive, busty tavern wenches in my realm will be replaced with surly, world-weary waitresses who will provide no unexpected reinforcement and/or romantic subplot for the hero or his sidekick.
  32. I will not fly into a rage and kill a messenger who brings me bad news just to illustrate how evil I really am. Good messengers are hard to come by.
  33. I won't require high-ranking female members of my organization to wear a stainless-steel bustier. Morale is better with a more casual dress-code. Similarly, outfits made entirely from black leather will be reserved for formal occasions.
  34. I will not turn into a snake. It never helps.
  35. I will not grow a goatee. In the old days they made you look diabolic. Now they just make you look like a disaffected member of Generation X.
  36. I will not imprison members of the same party in the same cell block, let alone the same cell. If they are important prisoners, I will keep the only key to the cell door on my person instead of handing out copies to every bottom-rung guard in the prison.
  37. If my trusted lieutenant tells me my Legions of Terror are losing a battle, I will believe him. After all, he's my trusted lieutenant.
  38. If an enemy I have just killed has a younger sibling or offspring anywhere, I will find them and have them killed immediately, instead of waiting for them to grow up harboring feelings of vengeance towards me in my old age.
  39. If I absolutely must ride into battle, I will certainly not ride at the forefront of my Legions of Terror, nor will I seek out my opposite number among his army.
  40. I will be neither chivalrous nor sporting. If I have an unstoppable superweapon, I will use it as early and as often as possible instead of keeping it in reserve.
  41. Once my power is secure, I will destroy all those pesky time-travel devices.
  42. When I capture the hero, I will make sure I also get his dog, monkey, ferret, or whatever sickeningly cute little animal capable of untying ropes and filching keys happens to follow him around.
  43. I will maintain a healthy amount of skepticism when I capture the beautiful rebel and she claims she is attracted to my power and good looks and will gladly betray her companions if I just let her in on my plans.
  44. I will only employ bounty hunters who work for money. Those who work for the pleasure of the hunt tend to do dumb things like even the odds to give the other guy a sporting chance.
  45. I will make sure I have a clear understanding of who is responsible for what in my organization. For example, if my general screws up I will not draw my weapon, point it at him, say "And here is the price for failure," then suddenly turn and kill some random underling.
  46. If an advisor says to me "My liege, he is but one man. What can one man possibly do?", I will reply "This." and kill the advisor.
  47. If I learn that a callow youth has begun a quest to destroy me, I will slay him while he is still a callow youth instead of waiting for him to mature.
  48. I will treat any beast which I control through magic or technology with respect and kindness. Thus if the control is ever broken, it will not immediately come after me for revenge.
  49. If I learn the whereabouts of the one artifact which can destroy me, I will not send all my troops out to seize it. Instead I will send them out to seize something else and quietly put a Want-Ad in the local paper.
  50. My main computers will have their own special operating system that will be completely incompatible with standard IBM and Macintosh powerbooks.
  51. If one of my dungeon guards begins expressing concern over the conditions in the beautiful princess' cell, I will immediately transfer him to a less people-oriented position.
  52. I will hire a team of board-certified architects and surveyors to examine my castle and inform me of any secret passages and abandoned tunnels that I might not know about.
  53. If the beautiful princess that I capture says "I'll never marry you! Never, do you hear me, NEVER!!!", I will say "Oh well" and kill her.
  54. I will not strike a bargain with a demonic being then attempt to double-cross it simply because I feel like being contrary.
  55. The deformed mutants and odd-ball psychotics will have their place in my Legions of Terror. However before I send them out on important covert missions that require tact and subtlety, I will first see if there is anyone else equally qualified who would attract less attention.
  56. My Legions of Terror will be trained in basic marksmanship. Any who cannot learn to hit a man-sized target at 10 meters will be used for target practice.
  57. Before employing any captured artifacts or machinery, I will carefully read the owner's manual.
  58. If it becomes necessary to escape, I will never stop to pose dramatically and toss off a one-liner.
  59. I will never build a sentient computer smarter than I am.
  60. My five-year-old child advisor will also be asked to decipher any code I am thinking of using. If he breaks the code in under 30 seconds, it will not be used. Note: this also applies to passwords.
  61. If my advisors ask "Why are you risking everything on such a mad scheme?", I will not proceed until I have a response that satisfies them.
  62. I will design fortress hallways with no alcoves or protruding structural supports which intruders could use for cover in a firefight.
  63. Bulk trash will be disposed of in incinerators, not compactors. And they will be kept hot, with none of that nonsense about flames going through accessible tunnels at predictable intervals.
  64. I will see a competent psychiatrist and get cured of all extremely unusual phobias and bizarre compulsive habits which could prove to be a disadvantage.
  65. If I must have computer systems with publically available terminals, the maps they display of my complex will have a room clearly marked as the Main Control Room. That room will be the Execution Chamber. The actual main control room will be marked as Sewage Overflow Containment.
  66. My security keypad will actually be a fingerprint scanner. Anyone who watches someone press a sequence of buttons or dusts the pad for fingerprints then subsequently tries to enter by repeating that sequence will trigger the alarm system.
  67. No matter how many shorts we have in the system, my guards will be instructed to treat every surveillance camera malfunction as a full-scale emergency.
  68. I will spare someone who saved my life sometime in the past. This is only reasonable as it encourages others to do so. However, the offer is good one time only. If they want me to spare them again, they'd better save my life again.
  69. All midwives will be banned from the realm. All babies will be delivered at state-approved hospitals. Orphans will be placed in foster-homes, not abandoned in the woods to be raised by creatures of the wild.
  70. When my guards split up to search for intruders, they will always travel in groups of at least two. They will be trained so that if one of them disappears mysteriously while on patrol, the other will immediately initiate an alert and call for backup, instead of quizzically peering around a corner.
  71. If I decide to test a lieutenant's loyalty and see if he/she should be made a trusted lieutenant, I will have a crack squad of marksmen standing by in case the answer is no.
  72. If all the heroes are standing together around a strange device and begin to taunt me, I will pull out a conventional weapon instead of using my unstoppable superweapon on them.
  73. I will not agree to let the heroes go free if they win a rigged contest, even though my advisors assure me it is impossible for them to win.
  74. When I create a multimedia presentation of my plan designed so that my five-year-old advisor can easily understand the details, I will not label the disk "Project Overlord" and leave it lying on top of my desk.
  75. I will instruct my Legions of Terror to attack the hero en masse, instead of standing around waiting while members break off and attack one or two at a time.
  76. If the hero runs up to my roof, I will not run up after him and struggle with him in an attempt to push him over the edge. I will also not engage him at the edge of a cliff. (In the middle of a rope-bridge over a river of molten lava is not even worth considering.)
  77. If I have a fit of temporary insanity and decide to give the hero the chance to reject a job as my trusted lieutentant, I will retain enough sanity to wait until my current trusted lieutenant is out of earshot before making the offer.
  78. I will not tell my Legions of Terror "And he must be taken alive!" The command will be "And try to take him alive if it is reasonably practical."
  79. If my doomsday device happens to come with a reverse switch, as soon as it has been employed it will be melted down and made into limited-edition commemorative coins.
  80. If my weakest troops fail to eliminate a hero, I will send out my best troops instead of wasting time with progressively stronger ones as he gets closer and closer to my fortress.
  81. If I am fighting with the hero atop a moving platform, have disarmed him, and am about to finish him off and he glances behind me and drops flat, I too will drop flat instead of quizzically turning around to find out what he saw.
  82. I will not shoot at any of my enemies if they are standing in front of the crucial support beam to a heavy, dangerous, unbalanced structure.
  83. If I'm eating dinner with the hero, put poison in his goblet, then have to leave the table for any reason, I will order new drinks for both of us instead of trying to decide whether or not to switch with him.
  84. I will not have captives of one sex guarded by members of the opposite sex.
  85. I will not use any plan in which the final step is horribly complicated, e.g. "Align the 12 Stones of Power on the sacred altar then activate the medallion at the moment of total eclipse." Instead it will be more along the lines of "Push the button."
  86. I will make sure that my doomsday device is up to code and properly grounded.
  87. My vats of hazardous chemicals will be covered when not in use. Also, I will not construct walkways above them.
  88. If a group of henchmen fail miserably at a task, I will not berate them for incompetence then send the same group out to try the task again.
  89. After I captures the hero's superweapon, I will not immediately disband my legions and relax my guard because I believe whoever holds the weapon is unstoppable. After all, the hero held the weapon and I took it from him.
  90. I will not design my Main Control Room so that every workstation is facing away from the door.
  91. I will not ignore the messenger that stumbles in exhausted and obviously agitated until my personal grooming or current entertainment is finished. It might actually be important.
  92. If I ever talk to the hero on the phone, I will not taunt him. Instead I will say that his dogged perseverance has given me new insight on the futility of my evil ways and that if he leaves me alone for a few months of quiet contemplation I will likely return to the path of righteousness. (Heroes are incredibly gullible in this regard.)
  93. If I decide to hold a double execution of the hero and an underling who failed or betrayed me, I will see to it that the hero is scheduled to go first.
  94. When arresting prisoners, my guards will not allow them to stop and grab a useless trinket of purely sentimental value.
  95. My dungeon will have its own qualified medical staff complete with bodyguards. That way if a prisoner becomes sick and his cellmate tells the guard it's an emergency, the guard will fetch a trauma team instead of opening up the cell for a look.
  96. My door mechanisms will be designed so that blasting the control panel on the outside seals the door and blasting the control panel on the inside opens the door, not vice versa.
  97. My dungeon cells will not be furnished with objects that contain reflective surfaces or anything that can be unravelled.
  98. If an attractive young couple enters my realm, I will carefully monitor their activities. If I find they are happy and affectionate, I will ignore them. However if circumstance have forced them together against their will and they spend all their time bickering and criticizing each other except during the intermittent occasions when they are saving each others' lives at which point there are hints of sexual tension, I will immediately order their execution.
  99. Any data file of crucial importance will be padded to 1.45Mb in size.
  100. Finally, to keep my subjects permanently locked in a mindless trance, I will provide each of them with free unlimited Internet access. (HAHA!)

Taken from- http://www.eviloverlord.com/lists/overlord.html

On hindsight, my bout of bad luck happened the day before my eye swelled up.

On Wednesday night, I was craving for chocolate banana cake from Secret Recipe. I waited for him to break fast and we set off for siglap at 8. I was soooo craving for it, i was planning to eat at least 3 slices! haha! When we reached, there were only 2 miserable pieces left and they looked extremely unappetising.. Walking back to the bus stop, i passed by Gelare, Starbucks etc, but was too broke to go in for a substitute cake.. so we decided to go to simpang Bedok to eat chocolate waffles instead.

After taking the wrong bus, ending up walking a long way there, we were informed that the stall has closed down for good! aaaarghhhh! Last resort, we went to Burger King to eat Hershey's Sundae Pie (U can tell how i was craving for chocolate) and guess what? it was sold out!!! waaaa... such bad luck!

In the end, we ended up buying Cornettos from NTUC.. :( tough luck!

I'm down with an eye infection of the century. Not only is my eyelid swollen, my eye white looks like marsmallows, and my vision is blurred. I woke up this morning and i thought i was going blind. I was panicking like crazy! Luckily i live near the hospital and i rushed down to the A&E with Fir (thanks baby).

My eye is reduced to half the original size, which wasn't very big in the first place. Waited for a long time in the A&E, apparently my condition wasn't life threatening enough, but to me it was! I thought i was going lind and i thought i needed operation.. *sobs* When i finally got to see the doctor, she looked like a fresh graduate out of medical school and she didn't know what was wrong. Then she brought me to another doctor and later i was transferred to an eye specialist.

I had to wait even longer for the eye specialist. The eye specialist was very thorough and gentle with me. He doesn't look like a doctor, he looked more like a lean lifeguard.. hurhur.. anyway, he said that my eye infection is due to viral sinus infection.

Hence, I now look like quasimodo(a.k.a the hunchback of Notre dame, the dysney version), have a mountain of medicine to finish, eye drops to apply every hour and an essay due on thursday (i haven't finished reading the book and the reference books i borrowed from the library). BAD DAY. understatement of the year.

sorry to traumatise you with the pic. but this is how my eye look like. :( so ugly.
